intro: Anemonidium mexicanum, commonly known as Mexican anemonidium, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes buttercups and other related species. The plant features showy, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics include palmate leaves and a hairy stem, making it identifiable in its native habitat.
